title: Razer's Latest Mechanical Keyboards Are Ultra-Thin
description: Low-profile keyboards are quite the concept.
content:
If you want a mechanical keyboard, you don't have to go for the ones with full-size switches and keycaps. There are tons of low-profile options that are just as clacky, even as they might have a tad less travel. Now, Razer's latest keyboards are here, and they're as thin as they get.

Razer has announced the launch of two new low-profile gaming keyboards, the BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed and the BlackWidow V4 Low-profile Tenkeyless HyperSpeed. The big thing about them, as we hinted to before, is how thin they are. The company's green (clicky), yellow (linear), and orange (tactile) switches have been redesigned in a new low-profile flavor, with a reduced key height and a shorter travel distance, which Razer states promotes a more natural wrist alignment for users and potentially increases comfort during extended use without the need for a separate wrist rest. The keyboards feature a front height of 18.5mm and an angled chassis to further support a neutral wrist position.

The new switches have a circular stem wall intended to let Razer's Chroma RGB lighting shine through the translucent top housing of the switch. Each switch is factory-lubricated to ensure smooth key travel and is rated for up to 80 million keystrokes.

As far as the actual construction, both the full-size and tenkeyless models feature a 5052 aluminum alloy top case for durability. Internally, the keyboards are equipped with dual sound-dampening foam layers and a stainless steel plate, which, combined with pre-lubricated stabilizers, allow for a clean and satisfying typing sound despite what the low-profile switches would otherwise allow for. Yes, these are thin, but they are still mechanical, and Razer wants you to be very aware of that fact while you're using it.

Both keyboards support Razer's HyperSpeed Wireless technology, which is basically souped-up 2.4 GHz connectivity with a polling rate of up to 1000Hz for low-latency input. A single dongle can be used to connect both the keyboard and a compatible Razer gaming mouse. The keyboards also support Bluetooth connectivity, allowing you to pair them with up to three different devices for multitasking across various platforms.

These are also probably as feature-rich as a low-profile keyboard can get. The keyboards include a clickable multi-function roller and a set of dedicated macro buttons. These controls provide quick access to functions such as media playback, volume adjustment, and custom macros without interrupting gameplay. The keyboards also feature a Power Saving Mode, which can extend the battery life up to 980 hours on a single charge. We also have Razer Snap Tap, which allows for instant prioritization of the latest input between two keys without needing to release the first—if used well, it could be a huge advantage in fast-paced games.

Both the regular model and the tenkeyless version are available for purchase on Razer's website.

The new keyboards are as thin as they are, with their switches redesigned for a more natural wrist alignment and increased comfort during extended use without separate wrist rest. The keyboards also feature a front height of 18.5mm and an angled chassis to support a neutral wrist position. The full-size and tenkeyless models feature a 5052 aluminum alloy top case for durability and are equipped with dual sound-dampening foam layers and a stainless steel plate, allowing for a clean and satisfying typing sound. Both keyboards support Razer's HyperSpeed Wireless technology and support Bluetooth connectivity for multi-device multitasking across various platforms.

FAQs
-
What is the difference between Razer™ Mechanical Switches and Razer™ Low-profile Mechanical Switches? Razer Mechanical Switches are full-height in nature, offering up to 4.0 mm in total travel distance, whereas Razer Low-profile Mechanical Switches have a shorter total travel distance of up to 2.8 mm. This enables quicker keystrokes, while still delivering a satisfying typing experience. -
Is the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed a hot-swappable keyboard? No, the keyboard does not feature hot-swap capabilities. However, it is available in 3 distinct low-profile switch options: Green Clicky, Orange Tactile and Yellow Linears. Availability and options will vary depending on layout types and regions. -
How do I check the battery life status on the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed? Using the dedicated battery life button, the number row will light up and show the estimated percentage accordingly. -
Can I pair the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed with a compatible Razer wireless mouse to the same USB dongle? Yes, you can easily do this via Razer Synapse, and it is highly recommended to use the USB dongle that came with the keyboard as the main dongle. Please visit our support site for a step-by-step guide to multi-device pairing. -
Can the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed be used both wired and wirelessly while charging? For wired mode, set the power switch to Wired and plug in the included USB Type A to Type C Cable. This will allow wired use while charging the keyboard. For wireless mode, set the power switch to Wireless and ensure that the HyperSpeed dongle is plugged into the main device. Plug in the included USB Type A to Type C Cable to continue charging the keyboard while using it wirelessly. -
What material is the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed made of? The top case of this low-profile keyboard is made from durable 5052 aluminum alloy, while the bottom case is constructed using ABS plastic. -
What is a top mount? A top mount is where the switch plate is secured to the top housing of the keyboard directly. This provides a typing experience that’s consistent on any part of the keyboard while also eliminating resonance and ping that’s commonly associated with integrated mounts. -
Is this device compatible with Windows Dynamic Lighting? Please view our list of compatible devices to find out. If your device isn’t listed, we highly recommend turning off Windows Dynamic Lighting to ensure the best Chroma RGB experience. -
Are third-party cables supported with the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed? As this is a product that requires high-speed USB, it is highly recommended to use the included USB Type A to Type C cable as it is designed to handle high polling rates and high-speed connection. Using other cables that are not USB High-Speed compliant will cause performance issues on the device. -
What is Razer™ Snap Tap and does this keyboard have it? Prioritize the latest input between two selected keys without having to release the previous one. Enjoy more responsive inputs for near-instant directional changes. This keyboard supports Razer Snap Tap onboard and is off by default. -
How do I toggle Razer Snap Tap? Hit FN + Left Shift to immediately toggle Razer Snap Tap. The A and D keys are paired to this mode by default. Paired keys will light up white when Snap Tap is on and light up red when Snap Tap is off. Snap Tap can also be toggled via Razer Synapse, including customizing with your choice of assigned keys. -
How do I ensure I am getting the best experience out of my keyboard? To achieve the best experience with your keyboard, ensure both the firmware and Razer Synapse have been updated to the latest versions. -
Is there a tenkeyless version of the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed? Yes! If you prefer a more compact layout, check out the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile Tenkeyless HyperSpeed —designed for minimal setups and maximum portability. -
Where can I find Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed gaming keyboard near me? You can purchase it at razer.com or use the store locator to find a retail location near you.

Maximum battlestation impact, minimum silhouette. Razer’s latest keyboards deliver top-tier performance in an ultra-slim form, featuring Low-profile Mechanical Switches, wireless connectivity, and a full suite of controls.
Razer™, the leading global lifestyle brand for gamers, today unveiled the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed and Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile Tenkeyless HyperSpeed, its most advanced low-profile gaming keyboards to-date. These new additions to the award-winning BlackWidow line bring cutting-edge performance and refined ergonomics to a slimmer, more streamlined form factor.
Designed for immersive gameplay and precision control, both models feature Razer HyperSpeed Wireless technology, dedicated macro buttons and controls, and for the first time, Razer Low-profile Mechanical Switches. The result is quick and precise actuation, satisfying keystrokes, and a streamlined silhouette that fits seamlessly into any setup.
“The Razer BlackWidow has been a staple in gaming setups for 15 years. As one of the most iconic and recognizable keyboards in the industry, it has consistently set the benchmark for performance and immersion,” said Barrie Ooi, Head of Razer’s PC Gaming Division. “With the BlackWidow V4 Low-profile line, we’re introducing a new form factor that meets the evolving needs of gamers, while staying true to the immersive experience that defines the BlackWidow legacy.”
Comfort Meets Durability
Razer’s popular green (clicky), yellow (linear), and orange (tactile) switches are now available in a low-profile format, delivering the same satisfying keystroke in a sleeker, more ergonomic design. The reduced key height encourages natural wrist alignment, enhancing comfort during long gaming sessions — be it grinding levels, climbing ranks, or exploring open-world adventures — all without a wrist rest. An ultra-low 18.5mm front height and angled chassis further support neutral wrist positioning for long-lasting comfort.
Each switch is engineered with a unique circular stem wall that ensures unobstructed light transmission, allowing Razer Chroma™ RGB lighting to shine brilliantly through the translucent top housing. Factory-lubricated and rigorously tested, the switches offer exceptional stability with minimal wobble for consistent, reliable performance. Rated for up to 80 million keystrokes, they are built to withstand the rigors of competitive play and surpass the industry standard by 1.6 times.
Designed for durability and precision, the mechanical keyboards feature a premium 5052 aluminum alloy top case, dual sound-dampening foam layers, pre-lubricated stabilizers, and a stainless steel plate. Together, these elements deliver a clean, crisp typing sound and an ultra-satisfying keystroke feel.
Unrivaled Speed, Seamless Connectivity, Total Control
Powered by Razer HyperSpeed Wireless, the wireless gaming keyboards deliver ultra-fast 2.4 GHz connectivity with up to 1000Hz polling rate for lag-free responsiveness. Gamers can pair a compatible Razer gaming mouse to the same dongle and connect up to three Bluetooth devices for seamless multitasking across platforms.
Both models feature a clickable multi-function roller and a full suite of dedicated macro buttons and controls, giving gamers quick access to macros, music, and battery status with just a tap or scroll – no interruptions to gameplay. With Power Saving Mode, users can enjoy up to 980 hours of battery life on a single charge, making it ideal for long sessions, whether grinding rank or streaming all night. Built-in Razer Snap Tap adds a tactical edge by instantly prioritizing the latest input between two keys, without needing to release the first.
The Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed and Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile Tenkeyless HyperSpeed are designed to elevate any battlestation with cutting-edge performance, ergonomic comfort, and a refined, ultra-slim form for an all-out immersive gaming experience.
For more information on the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile HyperSpeed, please visit: https://www.razer.com/gaming-keyboards/razer-blackwidow-v4-low-profile-hyperspeed
For more information on the Razer BlackWidow V4 Low-profile Tenkeyless HyperSpeed, please visit: https://www.razer.com/gaming-keyboards/razer-blackwidow-v4-low-profile-tenkeyless-hyperspeed

Both models support Razer's HyperSpeed Wireless technology and Bluetooth connectivity, allowing for seamless multitasking across devices. They include a durable aluminum top case, sound-dampening foam, and a variety of macro controls, promising a satisfying typing experience with up to 980 hours of battery life on a single charge.
